author: SurvivingPsychiatry
title: She saved my life tonight and she doesn’t even know it
body:
Tonight I contacted Breathing Space through Webchat and I was connected to Geraldine. I was struggling with intrusive suicidal thoughts and I’ve spoken to Geraldine in the past and she is one advisor who can always calm me down and make me feel safe, listened to and calm.  
Instead of changing the subject or referring me to other agencies, Geraldine is not afraid to tackle the situation at hand. She is also not afraid to discuss suicidal thoughts when some advisors shy away from this. She helps me untangle my thoughts, she listens to me and makes me feel seen.  
I was in a really bad headspace tonight before contacting Breathing Space through Webchat, and Geraldine made me laugh. She always remembers me as I do her and asks about my cat. It’s the small things that can make you feel cared for. I’m so thankful that I got to speak to my favourite advisor tonight as she got me from feeling very suicidal to laughing and putting a smile on my face. I feel much calmer after speaking to Geraldine and I really hope she gets to know what a difference she makes to my life. She saved my life tonight and she doesn’t even know it.  
I really wish I could meet her in person and give her the biggest cuddle because if I could I would. Geraldine is an absolute credit to Breathing Space and I hope she gets this feedback. I wish her a ton of love and happiness in life.

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: scoreboardgr47
title: Exceptional care
body:
Whilst as a day patient at the dermatology department I became unwell. Dr Makin and her team admitted me to A&E and I was taken down there by a couple of staff members and made sure I was admitted and safe.  
I had taken unwell with Angina and have been attended to very efficiently by the cardiology department. If it wasn’t for the team and Dr Makin in dermatology I would not have gone to A&E myself and I would never have found out about the angina and been placed on a path to get well again.  
I am so proud of them and all the other staff at RAH.

author: charadc57
title: This place deserves to be here
body:
I’m in Carseview right now and the care is good and the ward is spotless.  
The doctors and staff are v professional (although some staff spend a lot of time on their phones at times).  
People love to pick out any negative stories they can, but in my view the unit is helping people every day who are at the end of their line.  
This place deserves to be here - I think lives would be lost without it

author: Bloem
title: Generally felt at ease with the whole experience
body:
Went to the fracture clinic ten days after my son broke his collar bone playing football.  
The whole visit took us 40 minutes. Very helpful and professional staff, from the reception to the nurses to the consultant. Very happy with the way the consultant went through everything. And generally just felt at ease with the whole experience. Many thanks. Job well done.

author: Young Male
title: Eating Disorder Journey
body:
I have recently been discharged from the eating disorder service based in the SHSCT in Armagh City. Although, unfortunately, I was unable to break the cycle and beat my eating disorders at this time, after nearly 2 years of outpatient care. I started off slow, however after a couple of months I started improving and challenged my eating disorder.  
However, in the last couple of months I was unable to resist bad habits with so much pressure going on in my life and began to go in reverse and ultimately feel I got worse. In saying that, this is no reflection of the Eating Disorder staff and team and the care I received from them. They provided so much advice and guidance which I understood and individualised the care to my life and my needs, as one size does not fit all. Sadly, I just couldn't bring myself to fully implement it into my life at this time with so much of life's pressures at the minute, however they reassured me that when I was ready I could try seek help from them again in the future when there was more stability in my life.  
I have to give a huge mention to Pauline, the nurse who delivered almost all of my care and who supported me so much through the process. I know that without her I would be in such a darker place in my life right now, even though I still wasn't able to fully beat it. Thanks again so much !

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: songthrushke46
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Respected and Supported
body:
The individual respect and not being treated like a can of beans! My employment specialist is always flexible and meets my needs.  
I'd like to thank Terri she's always helpful :)

author: Nh81
title: Professional, caring and reassuring at what was the worst minutes of my life
body:
My 22-month-old took a febrile convulsion in the car. After calling Dalriada Dr I was advised to go to A&E, his condition deteriorated on route and I called 999.  
I can't stop thinking about how thankful I am to the lady on the call, and I hope she gets to read this and to know how professional, caring and reassuring she was at what was the worst minutes of my life.  
It was an awful drive, but she kept me safe and focused on the road, and reassured me my son would be OK until we got there.  
An amazing woman. I think this team are not paid enough for such an incredible and unthinkably difficult job! Thank you.

author: Audrey92
title: Go out of their way to help and assist you the best possible way they can
body: Excellent service from reception, admin staff , auxiliary nurses, practice nurses and the GP's in the practice. Each and every one in the practice is so professional, friendly, approachable and go out of their way to help and assist you the best possible way they can. Just want to let them know how much it is appreciated. Well done

author: ebeb2345
title: Booking line for podiatry
body:
I had an appointment for podiatry at West Mendip Hospital, I didn't end up having my appointment and after a 45 min drive, which my husband had to book time off from work to take me as I don't drive I was very disappointed to find that my appointment had been cancelled. I had no notification, no phone call or letter to say the appointment had been cancelled and on top of that I was informed I have been taken off the system!  
I have tried to get through on the booking line 5 times and my last attempt i ended the call when I was still 14th in the queue.  
The hospital receptionist were lovely and also tried to get through to the booking line on my behalf. The booking line staff we spoke to were rude and unhelpful to myself and the hospital reception staff.  
Ive been waiting since 2019 for this appointment and now to be told Im off the system is infuriating.

title: Completely useless. Run as far away as possible!
body:
When this surgery was also the walk-in centre, it was the best surgery I had ever been at. Since it is now solely Turner road surgery, I’m not sure how it can even call itself a doctors surgery. 

For over a year I have been actively trying to book an appointment for myself and my son for referrals for an assessment. Everytime, it’s the same answer. No appointments left. I sit on hold for over an hour, every morning I can to be told the same thing. I ring as directed for a prebook appointment and get told there aren’t any left and they don’t know when the next lot will be released. I’ve been doing this routine for over a year now.

In the 4 years I was on anti-depressants, I never got called in for a review and the reception team wouldn’t let me book one because a gp hadn’t requested it. In this time, I had a breakdown and tried to take my own life because I wasn’t on the right dose. After that incident, I never heard from the gp again until a year after I stopped filling my prescriptions. Oh, and they never sent y prescriptions on time and rarely got the dose right on them either. 

Recently, my youngest (4) was sent home from nursery with a fever and a rash. It was the same story, no appointments, no telephone appointments, and no emergency appointments. They offered to book me in for the next day, but honestly I was worried about my child and declined as she needed care now. I then paused and waited for the receptionist to say the obligatory “if you are really worried then you should take her to a&e or ring 111”. She didn’t say anything, no suggestion of how I could get my 4 year old daughter the care she needed. Turns out she had scarlet fever and I had to take her to a&e after ringing 111 because of her temperature. 

I have never had a pleasant interaction with the reception team, they always seem uninterested in helping you and treat you like a burden for using their service. I’ve also never seen the same doctor or nurse more than once. 

Honestly, run! As far away from this gp surgery as you can. They do not care for their patients in any way possible and everyone I know that is at this surgery has had exactly the same experience as me.

author: Haj1
title: The entire process was smooth, friendly, efficient and informative
body:
I had an appointment at Burnside House, ARI. I was not familiar with the layout of ARI and arrived in good time to find my way to Burnside House.  
At the Main Reception I was met by staff, told them where I was going and I was immediately taken outside to a waiting bus by a very pleasant, informative member of staff.  
Within minutes I was transported to Burnside House by the proactive driver, who gave me more useful information on how I could get back to the car park.  
At Burnside House the entire process was smooth, friendly, efficient and informative. From the reception, to the consultant staff, nurses and surgeon, I could not have been cared for any better.  
It is widely accepted that the NHS is operating under acute strain, yet the professionalism, patient focus and efficiency of everyone that I had contact with at ARI, and in particular Burnside House, was exemplary. Thank you, NHS.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: violetef68
title: Urgent referral to Eye Infirmary
body:
Urgent referral from my optician, who diagnosed central vein occlusion. The staff member on reception was rude and uncaring (I was stressed to have lost the sight in my left eye).  
Told to take a seat, I should have been seen straight away due to time to treat occlusion is 4 hours.  
90 minutes later care assistant commenced triage. A senior member of staff saw the referral and told them I needed to be seen ASAP - I still waited another 30 minutes.  
The consultant was very kind but informed me the time limit for successful treatment had passed and there was nothing they could do for my sight loss and referred me to the stroke team.  
Staff involved in triage should be trained to know what is urgent and essential treatment. The letter I had explained the urgency. I also feel that they need to show compassion.

author: CRB123
title: An inspiring GP
body: I recently had a few contacts with my GP practice. Each time I spoke to Dr Chang (/Cheng sorry for spelling). I genuinely cannot fault the interactions at all. She was kind, empathetic and efficient. She organised referrals and prescriptions for me promptly. She is an inspiring GP and her patients are lucky to have her. One of the contacts was regarding my mental health, which is a topic I previously found very hard to discuss. Dr Chang was welcoming and approachable and handled everything I discussed in a matter-of-fact yet compassionate way. It truly helped me so much. I am very thankful for her.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: jazzhr84
title: Change of PrEP clinic location
body:
I attended my PrEP clinic appointment at the QMH in Dunfermline. Unfortunately, the clinic location has changed. There are several issues with this move that I believe are negatively affecting staff/patients/clinical efficiency (based on conversations with staff/my experience).  
1.The Carnegie Unit is not welcoming, designed appropriately for effective clinical delivery, and the new location generally sub-optimal.  
2. In the waiting area, the receptionist cannot see everyone (as there’s a huge block obscuring the space). The waiting area is not welcoming/when patients are called (who may be visually impaired/have hearing impairments) they may not make their appointments on time (as they’re not able to see the reception area properly).  
3.The receptionist is now behind glass (making you feel like you’re trying to take out a mortgage at a bank). This first point of contact is critical to a good patient experience and the glass undermines this important relationship.  
4.The former clinic location (downstairs) was much better/more inviting/better designed and most importantly it was clearly a dedicated space.  
5. As this unit is NOT a dedicated space (unlike the former location) staff are having to work in a new area that is not appropriately designed, thus, undermining the timely and effective delivery of care.  
6.It seems as though staff have not been adequately consulted about this relocation and they need to be listened to by senior hospital management right now and moved back to the former location.  
7. Clearly, managing scarcity (economic/space-based/locations in hospitals) is the eternal challenge in the NHS (and there’s always some kind of opportunity cost). To my understanding, this move happened due to bed challenges during the current winter flu season. Guess the move should be temporary then? Either way, the clinic is not welcoming and other patients I chatted with did not like the new venue.  
8. Perhaps most importantly, sexual health is a VERY sensitive area and continuity of care/location continuity for appointments is critical from the patient perspective. This move to the Carnegie Unit should be reversed as soon as possible.

author: Decemberbabies
title: Skilled, knowledgeable and kind staff
body:
My care throughout my pregnancy was exceptional from my community Midwife Hannah in Airdrie to my consultant, Dr Malcolm. Hannah was knowledgeable, patient and kind throughout my pregnancy and it was because of her actions that I was scanned by Dr Malcolm at 37 weeks, some issues were identified, and I was brought in for induction.  
Throughout my induction I received amazing care from Karen, Lauren and Kerry-Anne, among others, before being taken round to Labour ward.  
In labour ward I was looked after by Eleanor and Amy. Words can’t describe how grateful I am to them. It was thanks to Amy’s actions that the fact my baby was in distress was identified and I was given choices regarding what could happen next by medical staff. I was kept fully informed and felt involved in my care and the decisions.  
I was taken to theatre for an emergency GA section, which was a very scary experience, but Amy and the theatre team were amazing and I felt me and my baby were in the safest hands.  
I was in for a few days in postnatal and the care I received was first class. Every single member of staff we came into contact with was skilled, knowledgeable and kind.  
Overall, although we had a traumatic experience, the staff involved ensured that both me and my baby were safe while providing excellent care. I’ll never be able to fully put into words how thankful I am to each and every one of them and think of them regularly when I look at my healthy little boy. Thank you to everyone who looked after us, you are all truly amazing.

author: listenwk65
title: My care has been exceptional!
body: I came into hospital to have a large ovarian cyst removed. The emergency procedure happened quickly, and my care from Ward 49 at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital has been exceptional! Can’t thank them enough :)

author: velacd54
title: I wish everyone courage to go through their journey
body: Where do I start. I have been an alcoholic for many years, putting myself in dangerous situations. I tried to commit suicide twice, drinking alcohol like it was going to go out of fashion lying to my kids saying things like I never spent the rent. In hindsight, I'm teaching them to tell the truth, and there's me lying so I decided to cut down on alcohol myself - which made me feel ill. So I went to the doctor's and they told me I was going through withdrawals and they sent me to the hospital. I went to the hospital for 3 days and they gave me a small detox which didn't work because soon as I left the hospital I was straight at the off licence to buy my drink. They then referred me to CGL which was the best thing they ever could do for me. Just amazing people and helped me loads, Lisa is fantastic she knows how much I can deal with. They referred me to Park House which I was scared to go, but still went and I thank god I did. When I came out I was asked if I wanted to go on to the day programme and I had heard loads of bad things about groups, that they don't work etc etc, but I still did it and I'm glad I did because I learnt so much. They have fantastic understanding, the team has great people and within the group you don't get judged. My confidence was so bad but they built me up and if whoever is reading this has the opportunity to do the day group - take it with both hands like I did because it helps, and every time you sign out you always take at least one thing with you. I was asked if I wanted to do the 12 weeks instead of the 5 and I did, and now I miss waking up in the morning and signing in to check in to see how all the amazing people are working on their journeys. I do still do zoom on the Thursday group to stay connected which is really good and worth a try too. I also do the art group on the Friday at East hub and I recommend that to anyone. Now I can say I'm a recovering alcoholic I've been sober for nearly 4 months and still taking it one day at a time.I wish everyone courage to go through their journey with all the help from CGL you will get there so let's all spiritually stand together and kick our addictions.

author: Troonron
title: Joint pain
body: Suffered with shoulder pain for months, got a appointment with Mr Jones at Templehill Surgery - listened, checked me over, found problem, and gave me exercises to improve joint 😁 happy days 👍

author: pelicanhm49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: There really is nothing more you could ask for
body:
I have had a very good experience in male medical. I have been treated so well. The nurses are amazing. They definitely deserve a lot more credit than they get. They are always checking in on me. The doctors have been wonderful. They are leaving no stone unturned. I have every faith in them with my care. They are amazing!  
The food is actually very nice. There is a great choice on the menu.  
The ward is clean and it’s warm. There really is nothing more you could ask for. I think we are very lucky. I am very happy with my stay

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: defenderqd35
title: Complicated twin pregnancy and neonatal stay
body:
I was pregnant with monochorionic diamniotic (MCDA) twins and was being looked after by Northern Trust and at 19 weeks we discovered they had Twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome (TTTS). We had to rush to Fetal Medicine in Belfast to confirm and then fly to London for surgery. The staff throughout were amazing and comforting.  
After the surgery we were seen weekly by Fetal Medicine in Belfast and the twin clinic in Antrim, things were improving until my waters broke at 22 weeks. I was admitted to Antrim and a few days later I was rushed to Belfast. The whole experience was terrifying, I know the situation was bad but after a few days of no symptoms of labour the doctors starting telling me the worse was going to happen despite nothing changing with my situation, this was I felt unnecessarily upsetting, didn't help it was also my birthday. I was offered the steroids at 23+3, there seemed to be a lot of confusion over what twins waters had broken and it was quite upsetting. I was re-scanned by Belfast when I arrived but they were unsure as both babies had good fluid around them.  
In Belfast I was admitted to E ward and put in a side room, the staff were amazing and looked after me so well - Maria, Hannah, Deborah and Maeve, as well as Leanne and Kirsty, there were many others but unfortunately I cannot remember their names. The facilities in E Ward were not great, one shower was closed the entire time I was there and often one of the 2 other showers would also be out of order, probably holding out for the new building instead of fixing, but 1 shower for 20 beds was not good.  
I remained on E Ward for weeks, being scanned daily by Helen and weekly at the twin clinic. Helen was amazing, she always made sure I had plenty of good scan photos, she always used their names, it meant so much when we didn't think they'd be coming home, she explained the results of the scans every time and celebrated with me when things started to look better. Dr Murnaghan at the twin clinic was also reassuring without being patronising, she explained the situation well and I always felt better after a twin clinic appointment.  
At 28 weeks I started bleeding and passing large blood clots, I was sent down to delivery, but as it was a weekend they were trying to hold off as long as possible, the bleeding eventually stopped. On Monday I went for one of my usual scans with Helen where she told me I'd likely be having the twins that day as she suspected Twin Anaemia-Polycythaemia Sequence (TAPS). She comforted me as I cried. She came down to delivery suite with me.  
My babies were born via emergency c section weighing 667g and 1171g, they were sent immediately to NICU and I was in recovery, I lost a lot of blood and was unable to see the babies for a while, but due to staff shortages this wait was made even longer.  
I was asked to wait until after shift swap, then I asked again a couple hours later and was told one of the babies was coming off the ventilator and to wait. Then I heard nothing for hours and no midwife came near me.  
I tried to find the number for NICU as I was terrified the worst had happened. The midwife returned to me in tears and she said she would call them but she went out of the room again and didn't update me.  
Eventually I was told my midwife was in another delivery and I would be moved to the ward. I was assured the babies were okay but I didn't believe anyone as I still wasn't able to see them.  
I was returned to E ward, I cried as they wheeled me down to the shared ward like I was any other new mum. I could hear the babies crying unsure if mine were actually still alive, the staff on the ward were shocked and helped me into a wheelchair so I could see my babies finally 14 hours after having them.  
I spent 2 days on the shared ward, I spent my time in NICU or with headphones with a curtain around me as it was so painful being amongst all the newborn babies. Women with babies in NICU should not be on the ward with babies. I left as soon as I could. I was distraught leaving and was comforted by Hannah and also Maria, who sat with me and shared her story. I will be forever thankful to the staff on E Ward.  
My twins spent 31 days in the Royal Neonatal unit, where parents are not as involved in care, details about your child's health are not given to you. One of my twins had a large Patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) which I discovered when she was moved to Antrim despite me asking in the Royal did she have one!  
The nurses seems very wary of getting out my smaller twin, I think this was because they were new. Everything changed in Antrim, I was told everything about my babies, I had plenty of skin to skin with both babies, it was easier to express for the twins and overall was a better experience.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: camelopardalisqg88
title: Spirometry
body: Very quick, efficient staff, I felt at ease, everything was explained to me as we went along.

author: TARA>
title: It really has made a difference to my well being!
body:
My time at the Fern Centre has been a godsend.  
I always come away feeling relaxed and renewed -ready to face the challenges of day to day life.  
Thank you so much, it really has made a difference to my well being!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Kc22
title: Left feeling a wee bit confused
body: I was supposed to have surgery this week and it has been canceled but I’m not sure who to contact. Could someone provide me with the ENT waiting list contact info? I was due to be operated on in the Mater BHSCT but it was then cancelled as they would like to operate now in the royal hospital but I just haven’t heard anything? But I’ve had my pre assessment. I'm a bit confused and would appreciate some clarity.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Dafferdowndilly
title: Two visits to the hospital
body:
(1) Tripped over nothing in my lounge! Friends took me to A&E at RD&E in Exeter. Saw number of staff for various reasons, ALL of whom were so lovely and friendly and made me feel very comfortable and safe in their hands. I was admitted into A&E and I just want to mention 2 staff members who were exceptional - Dan & Gayle. They went the extra mile and made me almost enjoy the whole experience! The whole happy attitude of the staff overrides the negative reason why I was there.  
(2) Following day back to same hospital to keep appointment to have tumours removed from leg. The local anaesthaetic didn’t happen until half way through after they had to do whatever on my legs. That was very painful and the 8 staff members in the operating room were very kind, one nurse holding my hand and talking to me to take my attention away from the painful things that was happening. They were a cheerful team but the procedure was not so enjoyable for me as the previous one the night before had been.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Jason234
title: Recovery is the best possible life
body:
Inclusion helped me turn my life around by supporting me and valuing me better than I’d ever experienced from my family, or any one else for that matter.  
Even though I’d been houseless and sleeping in a tent for three months (at the time), meeting my key worker was the first time I started to feel like I had a partnership in making my life a better place.  
To be honest, I always kind of had a feeling that I could do it, but with my difficult family relationships - I felt totally abandoned more times than I had hot dinners. I always ended up making things for myself worse off (when I trusted them to help me) than when I started off with anything on my own.  
But not here at Inclusion (IOW) Dynamical and fully positive support was just what I needed to make the necessary changes that helped me to start making something really great out of my life.  
As far as I can see I definitely couldn’t have done it alone, as even though I have had some experiences with rehab and group support, I found the right tools for me to move from a life unmanageable into what I see now as a normal and successful, as well as meaningful and fulfilling, life of infinite possibility.  
Thank you so much guys - it feels like I have a new improved family now.

author: Brian08
title: The whole experience was not a problem
body:
I tend to get nervous going on hospital appointments. I had a CT scan yesterday in Altnagelvin Hospital in Derry, but all I can say is the staff were lovely and put me at ease and the whole experience was not a problem.  
Sometimes I hear negative talk about Altnagelvin, but having been in as a patient last year all I can say is the treatment I received was excellent in A&E on arrival and then in the ward. The staff, as in any NHS hospital that I have had dealings with, always go over and above with their care for those patients. Just want to say thank you.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: KITyb43
title: After 30yrs I do not have the problem anymore!
body:
My story started probably about 30 years ago maybe longer, I know this is hard to believe.  
When it started I thought I had an ear infection went to the doctors nothing wrong.  
The episodes became more frequent I then went private to see a consultant and he explained what was wrong and I was suffering from Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV).  
I have been living with problem until recently when my doctor sent me to the physiotherapist. Jennifer was fantastic and after a few sessions of Epley manoeuvre I do not have the problem anymore! I can't believe it after 30 yrs. It might come back but at least I know what to do now.  
I can't thank Jennifer at Borders General Hospital enough

author: Itsokaynottobeokayvet
title: Health concerns dismissed
body:
The prior 24 hours before my planned admission as a voluntary in patient, I took two seizures which caused new and pre-existing injuries to worsen. I made staff aware of the issues but these concerns were simply dismissed. I spoke to the senior staff member aswell regarding this I was told I wasn't there for my physical health and that I should be focusing on my mental health.  
At this stage it was afternoon time on day 2 of a 6-day admission. I hadn't even received the basic physical examination, which is conducted on arrival usually. Only on day 3 the duty ward doctor discovered the extent of these clear to the eye injuries and offered to increase my pain medication and suggested Physio input while I was on the ward. This is the funny part the OT had seen me and did an assessment on the first day and agreed I was perfect capable of doing everything for myself when it was apparent this simply wasn't true. I feel that pressure from social work management affected this decision. Otherwise they would have identified these problems, but wrote me off as fit and well and it was only apparent to staff I wasn't when the doctor did a physical examination.  
Now I'm not medically trained but I can tell when someone is in severe pain. I was dismissed by another staff member for even suggesting that someone look at my pain medication and was told it's my fault that my medication was reduced after following an overdose prior to my admission. Basically I felt blamed for my poor mental health and that I had to just get on with the physical pain because I made that poor choice. Talk about working without judgement - not very professional!  
Later I self discharged and staff were happy to let a patient do this even after telling them about a suicide attempt and that I'd had intentions to end my suffering myself.

author: golfmh94
title: A fantastic team
body:
My daughter (aged 9) attended an appointment at the local health centre after concerns regarding her mental health, plus the optician had stated that she may have papilledema.  
At this appointment the GP called the Borders General Hospital to see if it would be possible to get an urgent MRI for her.  
The GP said she would call me with a potential day/time. She called me straight away and asked that I take my daughter straight to the BGH to Ward 15.  
Upon arrival my daughter was extremely distressed and the nurses were fantastic with her, distracting her, speaking to her, calming her.  
Then the consultant came and spoke to us, my daughter was at ease straight away.  
The team managed to arrange an MRI for the following day, meaning that the anxious time was reduced.  
We then went home and the consultant called to say we could attend the hospital straight away for the MRI.  
Thankfully the team once again in Ward 15 reassured both my daughter and myself of the process and instantly we were at ease.  
The staff in the MRI team were amazing, my daughter managed nearly 30 minutes remaining still for the scan.  
We then went back to Ward 15 to await the results of the scan. Once again the team were fantastic.  
After a few hours my daughter received the all clear. Following this we went to the eye clinic for further assessment. Once again the team were amazing.  
Overall we are really impressed with all colleagues we dealt with, the team's attitude, knowledge and understanding during a really difficult time.  
Thanks to all involved, from the GP, the nurses, the consultants.

author: homamch96
title: Not the first time I have left in tears
body:
I attended the headache clinic and left in tears and shaking. The member of staff I saw had no compassion, and I found them patronising and rude. I spoke with some other staff as soon as I came out, they were lovely and calmed me down.  
I expect health professionals to help me work out a care pathway if the one I am on is not working, I do not expect to leave shaking and upset. This is not the first time the member of staff has spoken to me in this way, and not the first time I have left in tears.

author: severitydj53
title: Ingrown toenail removal
body: Really anxious about getting the anaesthetic and the pain. Felt sick, absolutely shitting myself, hate pain. Staff at Broughty Ferry Surgery who did the removal were great, made me feel at ease.

author: lyrakx96
title: Diabetic patient in A&E
body:
I visited the A&E department this week, presenting with significant levels of blood ketones as a type 1 diabetic, suffering from a vomiting and diarrhoea bug for several days. This is considered a very urgent medical case.  
I attempted to call ahead to seek specialist advice, but was firstly cut off after the switchboard, then after finding a number was told by the diabetes specialist nurse admin and that they couldn't help me and I could be waiting hours for a response. There is no direct phone number for the DSN.  
The staff in A&E were flat out and never stopped; the department was very busy. I spent about 7 hours there and never met anyone specialising in diabetes to help me. My blood/urine test results showed 5 critical results, which I questioned but felt I was brushed off and sent home with anti-sickness tablets. There is a definite fear in HCPs about diabetes if they are not specialists, but to me this is dangerous, negligent care; and doesn’t adhere to the healthcare essentials for people living with diabetes.  
In general, the A&E department felt like it lacked information for visitors about where to go, what to do and what the process is. I feel if people understood these things better, there might be a smoother experience for all. Particularly for the significant number of elderly patients attending. Some facilities were lacking basic supplies such as toilet roll and paper towels, and were quite unclean.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: tennand
title: Very satisfactory op and trouble free
body:
Very satisfactory op and trouble free, thanks to Dr Wilson and staff.  
Follow up included Chloramphenicol drops which may have been in a badly manufactured container or may have been difficult because kept in freezer, but I found it very hard to squeeze drops out and they had no/little smarting effect to tell me they had arrived in the right place. Unlike the Maxidex that was easy to use and which gave a slight sting.  
In hindsight, suspect I missed the first two days of Chloramphenicol because I did not realise the failure to arrive on the eye and mistook the natural soreness for success.

author: SurvivingPsychiatry
title: A fantastic Doctor
body:
I had to contact NHS 24 at around 3 am as I had a sudden onset headache after vomiting due to heartburn. I suffer from migraines but I had never experienced pain like this before it was extremely painful. This frightened me as it was nothing like I’d ever experienced before.  
The Call Handler transferred me to Nurse Clinician Margaret who was so kind and done a further assessment before arranging for me to be seen at Stobhill Out of Hours Service.  
The call from GG&C Health Board quickly came through with an appointment for 5 am.  
Unfortunately I couldn’t get a taxi on time to my appointment and where I live there from Stobhill was no alternative transport.  
Now this is where the real credit lies. At 5.15 am Dr Lynch called me and asked if I was okay. I explained the above to her but she was still wanting to assess me in person. I finally made it to Stobhill just before 5.45 am.  
Dr Lynch was even kinder in person. She carried out a full Neurological Assessment and reassured me that she didn’t think it was anything sinister. She was calm, kind and made my anxiety lessen, as I was worried. She made me feel so safe in her hands as a GP and she fully listened to my concerns. She arranged for a prescription to be sent to my local pharmacy and gave me some cocodamol. She said if the headache was to worsen I was to attend Accident and Emergency and let them know I’ve already been assessed by Out of Hours.  
I am extremely thankful for Dr Lynch and her kindness towards me. She really did go above and beyond her duty to care for me and she made me feel safe. She also asked about my Mental Health and made sure I was feeling safe before leaving.  
Thank you Dr Lynch. I really appreciate your support and most of all your kindness. You are a fantastic Doctor and I hope you get this feedback. I wish you a ton of love and happiness in life.

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: decemberjc12
title: Super kind and friendly too
body:
I had a phlebotomy appointment this morning with Jeanie at Plean Street Clinic. I usually have quite a difficult time at phlebotomy clinics as they struggle to find a vein.  
Jeanie was super efficient and found one almost immediately!  
Absolutely painless and over in 2 minutes. She was super kind and friendly too.

author: P t s d
title: PTSD - hope for the future
body:
I had sessions with a professional committed therapist, who helped me realise goals I can achieve and overall was helpful, which gave me hope for the future.  
Happy with the care provided, definitely helps with determination as well.

author: Bizzylizzy
title: Infection Control concerns
body: Whilst walking from the car park to the front entrance I was surprised to see several staff members leaving their cars and heading to work wearing green surgical scrubs, one person stepped off a bus wearing them. It was my understanding that these should not be taken home or worn to and from home/different sites for infection prevention and control? Is there a dress policy?

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Greatful99
title: A lovely, warm and calming atmosphere
body:
I had to attend the Day Procedure Unit at OHPCC last week. From the minute I went through the doors until I left again - I can only describe it as being a positive experience. The non-nursing staff I met were kind, courteous and helpful - all of them - but I can’t praise the staff of the Day Procedure Unit enough.  
The Doctor carrying out the procedure was kind and respectful - but I feel I need to specially mention the Nurses. Each and every one of them was kind, understanding and made such a good job of putting me at ease - I was so, so nervous. There is just a lovely, warm and calming atmosphere in there - not something I have ever experienced in a hospital environment before. Thank you to all.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: patient216
title: There was nothing to be worried about
body: Well it was all very interesting and pleasant. Everyone was really lovely and the equipment was explained really well. The practitioner that looked after me was very good at putting me at ease. I've never had contact with the chest clinic before and I was very worried. Turns out there was nothing to be worried about.

author: Sharon234
title: This has had a massive impact on my quality of life
body:
I was referred to Consultant Dermatology at Royal Alexandra Hospital (RAH) after angiodema on face, hives on arms, itchy red swollen skin , red sleeve and having more allergic reactions to food during this time. I explained to the Consultant that in the past I had an allergy test at Ross Hall and was informed I was allergic to glucocorticoids.  
I was concerned to reason why my face was swelling and tried to show the Consultant dermatologist the photos of my symptoms but she did not take the time to look at them and seemed annoyed.  
I was sent for patch testing which was useful and several allergies were identified but not to steroids. I was given leaflets on my allergies but no follow-up with the Consultant Dermatologist and still no proper explanation to all the symptoms I had experienced.  
The flares resolved after 15 months, each flare having a significant impact on my quality of life but lessening as time went on to the point I was not being as sensitive to allergies, back to normal.  
I had a small amount of eczema on my wrist and thought ok I am not allergic to steroids and used a small amount of hydrocortisone on my wrist for over recommended time and am now going through the same symptoms again.  
I suspect I am going through Topical Steroid Withdrawal and that is what I was going through before without any support, however I have had no formal diagnosis as yet.  
I feel if this had been assessed correctly and I had been provided with advice, I would definitely not have used hydrocortisone again.  
This has had a massive impact on my quality of life .

author: L1am8
title: I am now enjoying my job more than ever
body:
I came over to Thurrock IPS Service for work as I was working somewhere which did not offer flexible working pattern and work life balance. I was assigned to Christina as my Employment Specialist.  
Christina was very helpful and supportive. She was very informative and with the advice she gave me, we put it into practice to set presence when speaking to my managers. This helped me to adjust my work pattern and now I am working better hours which is more suitable for me.  
The advice was the major turning point as I was unsure how to articulate myself with my manager in a professional manner.  
Christina still regularly checks in with me to make sure everything is OK and I am now enjoying my job more than ever.  
Thank you!

title: Minor Injuries Unit
body:
Absolutely amazing!!! 
My son who has additional needs was in with breathing difficulties, the support he received, the understanding from all staff and the way they went out of their way to make him feel safe, comfortable and in control, was an absolute pleasure to experience. 
Bearing in mind the NHS staff are under extreme pressure, they still made my son have as pleasurable experience as possible. 

I really am truly grateful. 
Thank you.

author: Neurorehabcentre
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A very helpful and polite team
body:
My admission at NRC was very interesting and gracious as I interacted with the nurses and other professionals.  
The Physio team were very helpful and polite to everyone, which helped to speed up recovery and would recommend this place to anyone who is looking forward to this kind of therapy .

title: Really good
body: The doctor couldn't be more help fill and reassuring, how ever go have more chance of getting an audience with the pope than getting a parking place. No wonder people are late for appointments or miss them altogether with the terrible parking situation.

title: Excellent clinical care provided
body:
Visited the practice to undergo a procedure which I was very anxious about given my previous experiences. 
I would firstly like to thank the receptionist who booked me in for my procedure, so patient, understanding and caring, helped to put my mind at ease. 
Secondly, the  two nurses who supported me throughout the course of the procedure, they were absolutely amazing. I’m so thankful for their kindness, support and compassion during my visit, so sympathetic and really reassuring. Their caring clinical practice meant the procedure was so less daunting and thankfully seamless.  I really was in the best care and had nothing to worry about. Thankyou again, feel blessed to be registered with such a great practice and such wonderful, caring and professional staff.

title: Excellent service by receptionists
body: I am grateful to all members of the reception team who I have spoken to. They have been patient, professional and attentive, no matter how busy. My concerns have been listened to and addressed.  I have been treated with respect, and as a partner in the management of my healthcare. Thank you.

title: Great staff
body: I attended cardiology department with my husband and I would like to say everyone we had dealings with were great. Consultant, blood department and the café staff.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

author: orionnz78
title: Recovering from stroke
body: Very grateful to the stroke team for being so generous and helpful during this time. I would like to thank Hannah and Julie for all their help. They are caring people who have supported my husband to recover. We are really appreciative of the support.

author: Milo.VHL
title: Von Hippel-Lindau syndrome (VHL) ground breaking treatment
body:
In 1996 I lost part of my right kidney to a tumour resulting in one week in hospital and three months off work.  
In 2001 I lost the rest of my right kidney to another tumour resulting in 5 days in hospital and four weeks of work (getting used to operations by now). My forward-thinking specialist/surgeon Mr Joyce asked if I would be willing to try a relatively new procedure in the UK when another tumour appeared on my left kidney in 2007 and from there a miraculous journey would start.  
Enter Doctor Wah and her team, a kidney and life saving intervention for me, because not only did they successfully remove a tumour from my remaining kidney in 2008 they spotted a tumour on my pancreas which only the year before my sister had died from, she was in her thirties.  
Using Radio Frequency Ablation, which in easy to understand terms is the use of needles guided by MRI positioned around the tumour then hooked up to a generator then using heat the tumour is destroyed. No big nasty scars one night in hospital and within two weeks I was back at work full time (I was younger then).  
The amount of kidney that is lost this way is well under a cm and my kidney function was back to normal within a few days. I cannot express what a game changer this was for me and my family, no long recovery, reduced mental stress and back to the husband and father I need to be. There is nothing worse than feeling everybody else needs to look after you and that I cannot do my job.  
Over the next few years I've had (I like to keep the team busy)  
2016 Cryoablation (extreme cold instead of heat) to remove another tumour.  
2018 Cryoablation yes another tumour.  
2019 Cryoablation you guessed it another tumour.  
2023 Cryoablation this time 2 tumours removed at the end of January  
Total 6 tumours removed from my left kidney and the function is still good  
and minimum loss of kidney tissue although it might take me 3-4 weeks to be back fully this time (I'm getting a bit older).  
I am very lucky that because of my condition, Von Hippel-Lindau syndrome (VHL), I am regularly scanned for the growth of new tumours, as was my sister, who had five tumours removed by conventional surgery and lost both kidneys. This is not a fault of the surgeons but unfortunately this treatment came a few years too late for her, but we can see from the above how ground breaking this treatment and others like it are to us all.  
In summery I would like to push for Ablation in any of its forms to become the first choice treatment for kidney tumours and any other areas it can be used in. Not all people grow tumours like I do but, and here is the big but, the NHS need to make this the number one choice as no surgeon knows how many tumours you will get in your life time, you might be lucky and its a one off and a easy operation, but what if you're not?  
What if you cannot cope with the stress and the scars of major surgery or the loss of a kidney before you are moved over to ablation. I think the money alone it would save the NHS must be recognised as soon as possible, not even taking into account how much easier it is on us the patient.  
Once again I would like to thank the Ablation Team and all the help from those at St James Hospital Leeds for keeping me going with such dedication, expertise and kindness.  
Kind Regards

title: Excellent help in a time of need
body: We had an emergency care situation with a loved one who is registered with the surgery.  The help, information and guidance we received from the surgery was both empathetic and prompt. This was and will be, going forward, very reassuring. Thank you for helping us at a very stressful time for our family. Much appreciated.

author: Mjs
title: Really comfortable
body: Really comfortable and all the ladies are lovely x

author: pilingsbd54
title: Nurses will fully support me so I can recover as soon as possible
body:
Got a leg ulcer  
Nurses are being very helpful. They seen me before and as soon as my ulcer reopens they see me as soon as possible and they listen to my nonsense all the time. My wounds are fairly difficult to heal but they ensure they are fully healed before I get discharged, even if my leg breaks down again nurses will fully support me so I can recover as soon as possible.

title: Overall a good service
body:
I have had three appointments using Ascenti.... The first and especially the last were positive.  An email with exercises from the second visit never materialised and I felt the practitioner had a poor command of the English language. 
Overall, I would not hesitate to use the service again and have appreciated the advice given. My need for the service was not necessary any more having followed the exercises recommended. Thank you.

title: Excellent care
body:
All the team from a & e, sdec & amu not forgetting cleaners, radiographers etc were great. They checked every avenue to make sure they got to the root cause of the problem. Although wait times are so long due to being so busy. They take the time to make sure best practices are followed. Despite being overworked a real credit. 
Thank you so much for looking after me so well I wish I could thank them more. 
Oh and the food was good too!! 
Abundant blessings to you all. Keep up the great vital work

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body:
Despite being extremely busy and hard to initially get through to, the surgery were amazing. There were no appointments left but they still allowed me to bring my grandson down straight away. They did this twice as he was not getting better. Staff were all lovely, the GPs, nurse and receptionists couldn’t have been more caring and helpful. 
Brilliant, caring surgery.

title: Amazing practice
body: They were very kind to me, asking at all times if I was okay, it has been a wonderful experience, they have made me feel very calm.

title: Excellent service
body: My phone call was dealt with efficiently by receptionist.  Appointment made within minutes. Nurse was excellent,  she then confirmed with a doctor who checked my injury  quickly and efficiently . Could not have wished for better. Extremely grateful

title: Great helpful practice
body: never had an issue with this practice, very helpful and friendly staff, such a great practice and very professional

author: HappyPh
title: Kind and reassuring staff
body:
I had to attend the X-ray department at Stirling Community Hospital for an abdominal scan.  
The HCA, who was there as a chaperone, Claire, made me feel “looked after”  
She was kind and reassuring from start to finish  
Thank you for caring

title: Great practice
body: Communication with the practice is efficient and clear. Their triage system via the online form works well. The online prescription service also works well and the pharmacists are always helpful. My experience has been that GPs are thorough, get tests done to understand what the problems are, refer to other health professionals when appropriate and follow up after initial problems.  My experience has been that all practice staff are helpful and patient. It is good to know that they are there!

title: Superb service
body: Considering all the troubles facing the NHS, I am blown away by the service and positive attitude that I have received from all those involved with my treatment and care. The latest surgical intervention was done with great skill and care, and even more so there was lots of fun during the surgery. It's actually hard to believe that the teams are able to remain so positive and determined to deliver a first-class service despite all the obstacles that they face. Please accept my grateful thanks for all your work on my behalf, it's so very humbling.

title: Very good practice!
body:
I have been with this surgery for 9 years 
and I have never felt let down once with the service they all give, they go above and beyond 
always to help in anyway they can.
The care my mother receives in her old age and the support they give me as a carer is amazing too.very efficient and always kind receptionists .

title: Exceptional care
body:
I called the reception first thing on Monday morning because I had a couple of strange symptoms that I was very concerned about. The receptionist was kind, helpful and decisive, and arranged for the on-call GP to call me back right away. The doctor phoned me very quickly, discussed my symptoms, and asked me to come into the surgery for a face-to-face appointment. In the consultation, the doctor was thorough and caring. They phoned the spinal-ortho on-call doctor at Southmead to confirm best next steps, and I was advised to go to A&E for an emergency MRI.
I was admitted as an inpatient to the hospital that evening for emergency surgery first thing the next day.
I cannot praise highly enough the speed with which the GP saw me, and the way they treated me both on the phone and in the face-to-face appointment. The GP was absolutely brilliant, and I am so, so grateful to them and Shirehampton Group Practice. 
I hear lots of horror stories about GP surgeries from friends and family, but I am very pleased to say that Shirehampton Group Practice is exceptional.

title: Nice experience
body: Upon arriving i was met with a smile which always helps when visiting a practice if you have worries, staff very friendly and helpful and you feel you are being listened to instead of just another patient. I couldn't recommend visiting this practice more.

title: Great Practice
body:
I contacted Upton Surgery using the online facility a couple of times within a week, their response both times was very quick. I felt cared for by the manner in which they spoke and they listened, came up with a treatment plan which was explained thoroughly to me. The phone consultation was as long as it needed to be and wasn't in any way rushed.  
First time of using the online system and I am very impressed indeed. It was easy to navigate my way around the online form.  
Keep up the great work.  Thank you Upton Surgery.

title: Not sure what's happened.
body:
This used to be a great practice with great staff. I'm not sure if under new management but there are a new reception team who don't appear to be confident in what they are doing. Slightly rude as they certainly do not want to go the extra mile as the previous team did. Trying to get a physical appointment is near impossible. Communication is extremely poor when chasing results. Follow up appointments with the same doctor are again near impossible. This used to be a great surgery but lately I'm extremely disappointed.
Also I have been having the same ongoing medical issue for 3 years now that has failed to be diagnosed. I had to go through some extreme difficulties until anyone actually took me seriously. I am still trying desperately to get the correct treatment but trying to get an appointment is ridiculous!

title: Very friendly and helpful
body:
Great experience of last 18 years with my gp surgery. 
Always helpful 
Front staff is very good and never had any problems with my service

title: No appointments despite getting straight through.
body: I rang up at 7:55Am using three telephones and got straight through at 7:59Am. Despite being No.1 in the queue, I was told they were very busy and didn't have anything but telephone appts. I have a chest infection and difficulty speaking, yet despite this I was told by the receptionist to go to Bishop Auckland hospital, for 12:15. I have difficulty getting there and this is now the second time in a row they've sent me there. The last time I went to Bishop Auckland the doctor there couldn't believe North House Surgery in Crook were sending patients there instead of dealing with them themselves. Am I being singled out? What is going on?!

title: Helpful and efficient
body: I had pain in my gum and none of the local dentists would be able to see me and suggested that I call 111. After a short wait I was put through to a very helpful and understanding woman who logged a callback with a nurse, within an hour had a call from a nurse and dentist and my problem was resolved. Really happy with the service.

title: Exceptional
body:
Visited Leeds branch pre operation and Bradford for cataract surgery.
From start to finish found everyone exceptional. Friendly, professional and caring. Cannot recommend them enough. Time from been referred to op was quick. Thank you.

title: Top practice
body:
This has been my practice for many years now, the staff and gp’s are all very friendly and welcoming.
I would always speak highly of my practice of ever the time arose to speak about who’s doctors is where and how the perform.

title: Great Practice
body:
Over the last two weeks of November 22, I attended nd had contact with several different doctors of the Practice.  I received excellent care and attntion on all occaisions.
My first contact via telephone I was put on  aiting list, but called back shortly and received good advice etc.
I have no problems with this Practice and have no difficulty recommending this service to anyone.  Thank you for your care.

author: watergm77
title: I honestly feel like a different person
body:
We have all just been through covid so my mental health was very fragile.  
I felt lost and a little bit out of control, scared really as to what I wanted to happen, not wanting to be here any more, I think a number of things got me to this point, being fragile, having a knee operation that put me out for 6 to 8 weeks, having an over active mind, studying and all the general rubbish that we all tend to have to deal with nowadays.  
It spiralled quite quickly it was like I was caught in this viscous cycle of not eating, not sleeping, no energy to do anything, not keeping up with my meds properly, feeling worthless and what is the actual point.  
I’ve suffered with my mental health most of my adult life mainly anxiety and an overactive mind and I can generally push through most things but this time it felt stronger, like I was lost, lonely and quite scared as to the fact I just wanted to end it all.  
I didn’t have the energy to fight it, even if I could of worked out how too, this is when I knew I had to reach out. It’s not just about me it’s about my family too, the people who care about me, my daughter and partner need me.  
I didn’t want to go through the doctors as it can be a long process and I was desperate, but learnt that I could refer myself, making that first phone call to inclusion was the best thing I could have done. I was in a bad place and needed some help. From the first phone call to my very last appointment I’ve felt looked after throughout.  
After a few phone assessments and a 3-4 week call once a week to decide which would be the best route for me which was well worth it, I was put on a course for high level CBT.  
I have had this once before so was a bit apprehensive as I found it didn’t help me but this time I wanted it to work, I needed it to work, so I put my all into it.  
As with everything there are parts that are quite hard but I found this time I was so open and receptive to all the information and tools that were given to me that I really started to enjoy doing it and seeing a difference in the way I was thinking, feeling, approaching and dealing with things differently. And I’d say that the tools given to me on a weekly basis, the one to one face calls and putting hard work in has helped me be at a place where I feel different now and I’m super proud of myself too for getting this far and still putting the hard work in.  
But, none of this would have been possible without Chris, he is amazing at what he does. He engages and it actually feel like he cares and understands which is so important. He made me feel relaxed from the off and really got me working on things and seeing things from a totally different perspective. Lots of homework was set which is where the hard work is at, but, he made everything seem so simple and doable. He was very supportive and is a credit to your organisation and has helped me no end and for that I thank him. He also has inspired me to want to look into being a therapist myself so I can help others - what a feeling that would be.  
Even at the end of my course I still feel supported. If ever I need anything Chris said to contact the team if I need them, but now is my turn. I suppose you get out of life what you put in. Teach yourself to be you’re own therapist keep using the tools given especially the monthly self assessment looking at things in black and white makes things so much clearer - well for me they do and like I said I wanted this but needed it more.  
I’m glad I made that call because I honestly feel like a different person, so much more strong, equipped and ready for what ever happens and taking one day at a time and excepting that life has lots of ups and downs it’s how we choose to see them and deal with them.  
A massive thank you to Chris and the team at inclusion and if ever you need a trainee give me a shout lol  
Much love

title: Getting through
body:
I tried to ring the surgery at 8am to get a Doctor's phone appointment only to get a message (man) saying this call queue is full please try later? As I had rung at 8am and is normally tells yo that you are in a certain place in the Queue this was not happening.
If this is the future well it's not working,and very frustrating

title: Marvellous service
body: Overall experience excellent. Great surgeon and staff. Put at ease by very attentive caring staff. Would recommend to anybody needing surgery.

title: Lovely Surgery and Staff
body:
Staff very caring, helpful and kind. 
Always go above and beyond to help and the E-Consult is amazing!
Same day response. Brilliant.

title: Excellent Teamwork
body: Attended A&E with haemorrhaging polyp, referred to Maxillofacial for assessment after stopping flow. Attended Maxillofacial assessment clinic few days later, and had polyp removed later same day. Excellent service.

title: The most courteous staff ever!
body: I was accompanying my sister to an Endocrinology appointment and we also had to go to the Pharmacy. Every member of staff who we encountered - approx six - reception and medical - were so helpful and kind. I know it should not be a surprise but it was particularly noticeable and we want to remark on it and thank everyone.

title: Great service
body: I moved recently and I’m new to this practice. Every point of contact has been welcoming and helpful, from accessing online systems to receiving treatment. Thank you, Front Street - such a tonic!

author: Johnston87
title: Very positive experience
body:
Recently attended Stracathro Hospital, Surgical Unit for ACL reconstruction and repair of meniscus. Excellent treatment and care from the very first minute of arriving. Welcomed well and met all nurses, doctors, surgeon, physio and anaesthetists within the first hour of arriving. Was well informed about the surgery and all staff were extremely helpful.  
Was well looked after after surgery and there was always a nurse available if anything was needed. Nothing was too much for them, even with them being extremely busy.  
Very positive experience from minute I arrived until the minute I was discharged.  
Thanks very much to all staff for their care.

title: Terrible service and attitude to patients
body:
Phone system is inadequate and loops resulting in patients being unable to contact them. 
No communication when they change your registered GP.  The phone back system is inconvenient when your working as no time can be given.

I have sympathy for the workload, but admo 
 inefficiency are adding to that unnecessarily.

title: Wonderful Team you all are!
body:
I am so thankful for the amazing care my son recently received from Strawberry Hill. My son of 15 had suffered a cough and cold since before Christmas but suddenly two weeks ago things changed and he became very ill.
I rang Strawberry Hill in a panic and pleaded for an urgent appointment. Reception were brilliant, they knew things were not good. 
We were seen very quickly and The Doctor took over. He gave my son a thorough examination taking great amount of time and care. He gave a diagnoses of suspected of pneumonia/chest infection. He wasted no time with urgent further tests at the local hospital. Blood tests, Xray, more appointments and most important Antibiotics meds .. the care was constant. There were two further check up appointments as The Doctor wanted to make absolutely sure there was improvement each time . My son is fully on the mend. Absolutely amazing care and extremely heartwarming.. thank you so much for the most wonderful care to The Doctor involved along with the rest of the Team at Strawberry Hill.

author: Kamraan
title: A lovely team
body: I was greeted by a lovely team at Ward 206 who took great care of me during the assessment. Everything went to plan.

links.id: i felt that i mattered and not just a number

title: Great Nurse
body: I visited the nurse today, she was friendly, warm and welcoming! This made a nice change from the old Nurse. Very professional service. Thank you.

title: Appalling patient care from receptionists
body: Back in November I had similar problems to what I’m facing now, where you just cannot seem to get past the receptionist at all, my child is 1 year old and I was refused an appointment in November for 3 days, I eventually got an appointment and the doctor was shocked when he saw the condition of my sons eyes. My son is 1 year old and has had this “cold” since October, he has had one course of antibiotics which were prescribed by out of hours as I couldn’t get in at the surgery, surprise surprise. Again I am facing the same issues, I set off to work at 7:30am and the surgery doesn’t open until 8am by which point I am 30 mins away. I asked for an afternoon appointment so my child can be seen as this is in infection as appose to viral (the same as when he was prescribed antibiotics) I was told I cannot have afternoon as they are not released until the afternoon or when the morning slots have filled. Having worked in a GP surgery before I know by about 9:30am latest all morning appointments will fill given the high volume of calls with patients requesting appointment and so I’m pretty sure leaving a gap in a clinic at 8:10am wouldn’t be a problem to fill. So now I will call at 1pm knowing full well by the time I call there will be nothing left as the morning appointments will have filled and the afternoon already released. Given the fact he is 1 year old, I have a 2 year old as well, sitting in urgent care because the GP surgery reception don’t seem to “care” working in a healthcare environment is not practical. I would not recommend this surgery to anyone and in fact I am in the process of finding an alternative. It’s a shame as when you actually get to see a doctor or speak to a doctor the doctors are actually lovely and very helpful and understanding

title: Have no Fear
body:
Having never been in hospital before at the age of 73 I was somewhat apprehensive at the thought of entrusting myself to the Bath Clinic.
I need not have worried. The staff were all caring, professional and helpful and I am very happy to thoroughly recommend them to any one.
It is reassuring to know that in these days of strikes and strife that such a first class service exists.

title: A&E and ICU Faultless
body:
Brilliant with my daughter who had suffered an unexplained cardiac arrest. Treatment given in A&E and Intensive Care was brilliant. She's now been moved to a ward and it has gone right down. 
Can't get to speak to anyone, no-one seems to listen to concerns, no update given as to treatment or procedures she needs and one nurse came into the bay in four hours I was there. This is not good enough.
Visiting hours are ridiculous, especially for people like me who come from a completely different area.
Wish she could have been transferred to a more local hospital when they stabilised her.
Not a patch on other hospitals. 
Certainly needs much improvement

title: Wonderful clinic
body: Had cataract surgery and all the staff couldn’t have been more professional.  Such a great clinic, from reception staff to surgeon, could not fault them.

author: AngiM79
title: Excellent care
body: I had a fall yesterday and attended Hairmyres A&E Dept with an arm injury. Although the department was busy I was triaged promptly by a lovely nurse, Frances, who treated my wound and reassured me. I then waited back out in waiting room to be called and taken to minor injuries. I was then seen in Minor Injuries by a wonderful nurse called Janette who took great care of me showing me patience and helping me as needed due to my arm injury. After an x-ray and wound care I was then transferred to UHW with an elbow fracture and given further great care. Thanks so much to both nurses who helped me yesterday at UHH with a painful injury ensuring I was kept comfortable and up to date on my care. Keep up the great work!

author: Johnjohns
title: Dignity and discretion
body: I had wart treatment. The whole experience was done with dignity, discretion and all staff were very kind and professional.

author: Don Pablo
title: Kind, conscientious and so very professional
body:
I was diagnosed as having prostate cancer in 2018--PSA score of 535. Since which time I have received excellent treatment in both Glasgow Queen Elizabeth Hospital and the New Victoria Hospital, Glasgow. My treatment is being monitored by Dr Alhasso (Consultant Oncologist) and his backup team including consultant nurse Fiona.  
I cannot adequately describe the treatment plan that I have received from this team other than to say that they are the true professionals of the NHS about whom we seldom hear much but to whom we owe so much.  
I have been recalled for further scans, and the treatment I received again in the Nuclear Medicine Department was kind, conscientious and so very professional.  
Again I am aware that there are numerous background people whom the patients (me) never see, but who in all their roles have contributed to keep me well. Thank You.

title: Very good service
body: Excellent lately  .. seen physiotherapy and nurse within short period of asking. All respectful knowledgeable and courteous.

title: Superb treatment
body:
Amazing, kind, expert care from doctors n nurses. Before n after care unbelievably efficient.
I am so lucky to have this hospital on my doorstep, used over the years by all my family without fault.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Much improved dispensary services
body:
For several months the dispensary have faced some challenging issues. Skilled  workforce, new computerisation in addition to the building move whilst the surgery was being extended. 
Add to that supplies where medicines have not been available. 
Today they have excelled and seem to have worked hard to transform the dispensary.

title: Excellent service
body: I attended the chronic pain clinic today to have injections for severe back pain. All members of staff were extremely helpful and professional.

title: Outstanding service & information
body: I have experienced & received outstanding advice & support & treatment today regarding the menopause. Factual information & referral information given too, Which  has helped me so much & I’m so grateful.

author: Scottish Visitor
title: Incredible service
body:
I was admitted to Ward 209 after being transferred from Dr Grays Hospital A&E/CDU teams on the 31st January 2023 due to a Kidney Blockage caused my a large kidney stone which required a stent. The teams of Doctors, Nurses, AHPs, Consultants (basically everyone) were amazing and I experienced the NHS at its finest. Special thanks to Donna, Dana and Dr Naz at Dr Grays Hospital and All the staff in ward 209 ARI, especially Nurses Tanya and Ashleigh who kept me smiling, Anna (I hope I got your name right, you were the consultant who saw me when I first came in to 209 and put me at ease) and my consultant who placed my stent! All incredible! Thank you.  
When later attending my out patient lithotripsy appointment in Feb I was incredibly nervous, however your Lithotripsy team are amazing and made me feel completely at ease. Happy, reassuring, helpful, understanding and fun (Not a word you often use in hospital).  
Jillian, Jackie, Steph & Lisa are a credit to NHSG! Even at the worst of my pain they kept me upbeat played my favourite songs, made me laugh and even held my hand until the large stone was “blasted” to dust. The care provided before, during and after my treatment was nothing short of 5* and I can’t thank them enough for looking after me :) THANK YOU!

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Great experience
body:
I had 2 appointments with the nurse regarding HRT. The whole experience was first class; I have had heard many stories from friends about bad experiences they have had from many different practices,
but she was so knowledgable, helpful and understanding. I was given amazing advice, plus also advice on what to research for my follow up appointment, so I knew exactly what I was doing and what to expect. Delighted with my experience

author: Alfiemac 1
title: Waiting for scan results
body: I contacted the people in my responses, I was told my results have been in but still I have not heard back. I have contacted the doctor's secretary numerous times and was told they would get back to me, which they have not done. I was told to contact the secretary again, but now it's just an answering machine. I have left messages and I still have not heard back. This is an absolute disgrace, there is no excuse for it, meanwhile people are suffering .

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

title: Wonderful surgery
body:
Sent in an online consultation request and was called back within the hour…
Went in to see a GP a couple of hours later.
Great service
